DataElement.preferredName: Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia Other Treatment Administered Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text to describe another kind of treatment for benign prostatic hyperplasia not previously listed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia Other Therapeutic Procedure Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A non-cancerous nodular enlargement of the prostate gland.  It is characterized by the presence of epithelial cell nodules, and stromal nodules containing fibrous and smooth muscle elements.  It is the most common urologic disorder in men, causing blockage of urine flow._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A noncancerous condition in which an overgrowth of prostate tissue pushes against the urethra and the bladder, blocking the flow of urine. Also called benign prostatic hypertrophy or BPH.

Concepts.definition: A non-cancerous nodular enlargement of the prostate gland.  It is characterized by the presence of epithelial cell nodules, and stromal nodules containing fibrous and smooth muscle elements.  It is the most common urologic disorder in men, causing blockage of urine flow.

Property.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
